ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Calculating AC
ygData.msgSnippet: Abashi, no offense, is full of crap.  A GREAT deal of analasys has gone into AC by players.  All you have to do is equip a peice of chainmail with 5ac then
ygData.messageBody:
Abashi, no offense, is full of crap. A GREAT deal of analasys has gone into
AC by players. All you have to do is equip a peice of chainmail with 5ac
then equip a 5 agi item
the 5ac item will add more than 12ac to your ac at level 34 whereas at level
34 with a 110 agi your ac will go up MAYBE 2 points.

There is no "straight" formula, but generally speaking, after about 100 agi,
it's better to go with AC before AGI
----- Original Message -----
From: "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, March 14, 2000 3:29 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Calculating AC


> From: "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...>
>
> AC is not a number that is even used by the game engine. It is a composit
> number made up of 2 parts: Hit avoidance and Damage avoidance. Your Atk
> rating is also a composit number: Chance to hit and Damage applied. If I
> remember correctly when Abashi made is famous post on stats he said
Agility
> affects the Hit avoidance portion of AC.
>
> Rokenn
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, March 14, 2000 12:26 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Calculating AC
>
>
> From: "Kevin L. Crawford" <Lyrnia@...>
>
> up till 100 it's nearly 1 to 1. After 100 it goes down dramatically.
After
> about 120 agil it's like 5 agil to 1 ac
>
> Whereas straight AC works with your defense bonus. Not sure the exact
> calculation but at level 34ish AC multiplier appears to be about 2.5xRAW
> (Where RAW is the raw AC of the item) . That's far from accurate, I
haven't
> done any 'testing' yet but that appears to be the case.
>
> Lyrnia Jongleur
